summary: The Stop CMV Act of 2025 aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to mandate congenital Cytomegalovirus (CMV) screening for newborns. The bill outlines procedures for states to establish screening programs, including data collection, education, and follow-up activities. It provides for grants to states through the Health Resources and Services Administration and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to support testing and technical assistance. Additionally, the National Institutes of Health will conduct research on CMV screening and treatment. The bill also amends the existing Advisory Committee on Heritable Disorders in Newborns and Children to include oversight of the CMV screening program.
